text: EUGENE CECCHINO, JR. the Defendant herein, having been first duly sworn, was examined and testified as follows: EXAMINATION
Mr. Cecchino, I have spoken to your attorney and also read some documents, so I know that you have hearing aids; right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.  They're not working too well right now either.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If I say anything and you can't hear me, just tell me and I will ask again.  Okay?  Is that fair?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.  Right now they are working too loud.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'll try to get quieter.  Is that better?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (No response.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now, I'm sure your attorney gave you some instructions, but for the deposition we want everything we are answering or saying to be verbal.  Is that okay?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (Witness indicates affirmatively.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that a yes?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So if at any point I know that you mean yes because you are nodding your head and I say "is that a yes," I'm not trying to be rude.  It's just so she'll write it down.  Okay?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In the same vein, I will try to let you finish answering before I ask you another question.  Okay?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Okay.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You are doing great.  Is there any reason that I should not take your deposition today?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I didn't understand that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you had any medication or alcohol or anything that would inhibit your ability to answer questions today?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I got it.  That's okay.  Are you okay to take a deposition today?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you had any medication today that affects your memory?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you had any alcohol today?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No alcohol.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'll try to be fast then.  Do you remember being involved in a motor vehicle accident in 2017?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: What?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember being involved in a car accident in 2017?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: October 7, 2017.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you remember where you were going that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I was having something to eat.  I was on my way home because I didn't feel like cooking myself.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did you have something to eat?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: At a restaurant.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it at the Wexford Ale House?  Did you have something to eat at the Wexford Ale House?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the day of the accident or right after the accident did you get arrested for a DUI for driving under the influence?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes; they arrested me.  They said I had one point over the legal limit.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many drinks did you have at the Wexford Ale House?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I had a couple.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think it was less than five?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Huh?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it less than five?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were you drinking that day?  Was it beer, or was it a mixed drink?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: That's all I drink is beer.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what time of day it was?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I'm not too sure of the time but somewhere around 8:30.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Dinner time; right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (Witness indicates affirmatively.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so when you left the Ale House, did you feel okay to drive the vehicle?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you are not sure how many drinks you had had?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.  You can answer.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: Just a couple.  That's all I had.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was the Wexford Ale House the only place that you had been drinking alcohol that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.  I left my apartment because I went down to the grocery store, got some groceries, and on the way home I stopped at the Ale House to get something to eat because I didn't feel like cooking when I got home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then you were involved in a motor vehicle accident on your way home; is that right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As far as that accident goes, were you driving on Weller Road -- or Weller Drive, rather?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: It was the road coming out to 19, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were going to turn on to Perry Highway; is that right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I don't mean to put words in your mouth; I'm just trying to help make it go faster.  So if I'm wrong, you just tell me.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I didn't hear.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm not trying to put words in your mouth; I'm just trying to help you go faster.  So if I'm wrong, just tell me.  Okay?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were turning on to Perry Highway.  Were you making a left-hand turn?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I pulled up to the stop sign and I was waiting to get on to 19.  Traffic was coming both ways.  I don't know how long I waited there.   I mean, it seemed like an hour. I mean, the cars were coming one way.  It was clear coming the one way.  They started coming the other way, so I had to sit there and wait.  I waited until there was -- I didn't see no cars either way.  That's when I started to pull out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have your glasses on that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: When I get up in the morning, I put my glasses on, and I take them off when I go to bed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you have your hearing aid that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.  I had them in.  That pair I lost.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where did you lose them?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: After the accident, they pried my door to get me out.  I was walking down to the ambulance and the guy was trying to check my vitals in my ear.  I says, "Oh, wait. I'll take my hearing aids out." He says, "Okay.  We'll take care of them.  We'll take care of them." And that's the last I seen of the hearing aids.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So where did the ambulance take you; do you remember?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: To Passavant.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Then after that they put me into another ambulance and they took me down to Presbyterian.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you were at Passavant, did the police take your blood, or did they take your blood at Presbyterian?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I guess they took my blood down there, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm sorry.  Where did they take your blood?  Which one?
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: Passavant.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: At Passavant is where they took your blood?
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: I guess they took it right there inside the ambulance.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember having your blood drawn at Passavant?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I don't remember that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you hit your head in the accident?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Not in the accident.  I hit my head several years ago.  I had 13 stitches in my head.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you went to UPMC Presbyterian, do you remember if they took your blood there?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But after this accident, you were charged with a driving under the influence of alcohol; is that right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you eventually pled guilty to that; is that right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes, that's right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it right that this was a DUI for a blood alcohol level of -- for over a blood alcohol level of point one?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: It was one point over eight.  The limit is eight; mine was nine.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you still have a driver's license?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Huh?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you still have a driver's license?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I had a driver's license, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have one now?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I sent it in.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did they take it as part of your DUI conviction?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I sent it in.  They were supposed to send it back to me this August, the 24th of this month.  I'm not getting them back.  I gave up driving.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: It's not that fun?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Had your license ever been suspended before?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: Yes, one time before, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it for a DUI also?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many DUIs have you had?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I'm not sure, but I think it was three.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the other two, when were they?  When were the DUIs that were not related to this accident, the older ones?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I don't remember that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it in like the nineties?  Does that sound right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so when you were driving the vehicle that day and you had been under the influence of alcohol, do you agree with me that it's not safe to drive a vehicle after drinking alcohol?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No; you don't agree with me?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (Witness indicates negatively.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think it's safe to drive a vehicle after drinking alcohol?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: I think I was, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  And when you pled to the DUI involving this accident, did you have to go on probation?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Pardon me?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you on probation for the DUI?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: After the accident, I went -- five times I went down to the courthouse.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Probably for that.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: And I got a six months' probation.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And after the accident, you told me that the firefighters or someone helped you get out of the car; right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.  They pried the door open because they kept pounding on there.  They thought I was trying to start the car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, did you -- go ahead.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: My car was automatic lock.  I was trying to get it into park so I could open the door.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what kind of car were you driving that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Huh?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What kind of car were you driving that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: A 2002 Pontiac.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you still have that car?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.  It's in the junkyard now.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: From this accident?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (Witness indicates affirmatively.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The other vehicle, did you ever speak to the other driver?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I didn't see too much of him.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever see how he left the scene?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you ever see -- well, let me ask you this question.  When was the first time while you were driving that you noticed the other car?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I don't remember that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you see him -- did you see the other vehicle at all before your cars collided?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I didn't see any other cars.  That's why I started pulling out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you hear any horns honking?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you hear anyone hitting their brakes really hard and then squealing?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: There was no skid marks either.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So was the first time that you noticed the other car was when your cars hit each other?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (Witness indicates affirmatively.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that a yes?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What part of your car was hit by his car?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I would say the left -- mostly the left front.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The left front of your vehicle?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In front of the passenger seat or beside the driver seat?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Right there by the driver's side.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What part of his vehicle collided with your vehicle; if you know?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I'm not sure about that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did your airbags deploy?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I'm not too sure because it happened so fast.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And someone had to pry you out of the car.  Okay. So did the police officers -- and I think I know the answer.  Did the police officers ever give you any field tests before they took your blood for the DUI?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did they ever have you breathe into a breathalyzer?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is this right, that all they did was take your blood to test you?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: That's all they did was take my blood.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have to go to the jail, or did they mail you your charges?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I had to go to the magistrate.  I mean, they just wrote the ticket out.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But they didn't think you were going to run away; right?  They didn't think you were a flight risk.  Okay.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (No response.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That was a no; right?
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: (No response.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That was a no; right?
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: Do what?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You want to ask him again?
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: I'll shorten it.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Did you ever have to go to the jail for your DUI?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Mr. Cecchino, I know we talked about this quickly, but let me ask you one more time and I'll try to be really clear.  Do you think, and I don't mean you in general, do you think that it is safe to drink alcohol and then drive a motor vehicle?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: Yes, I think so, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you think that on this day it was okay for you to be driving a motor vehicle?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I think so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you think that having had alcohol had anything to do with the motor vehicle accident happening?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think that it was reckless to drive after having drank alcohol?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so do you think that this accident still would have happened if you hadn't had any alcohol?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Do that again.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think you would have been in a car accident if you hadn't had any alcohol that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Well, it's hard to say.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think that -- strike that. Now, I know we talked about the fact that you had had your license suspended previously for drinking and driving.  Is that right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think that it is okay to drink and drive any time?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is there a certain amount of alcohol that you think would make it unsafe to drive?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I don't -- no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you realize that Mr. Miller was hurt in this car accident?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: (Witness indicates affirmatively.)
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that a yes?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think that this accident would have happened and he had been hurt if you hadn't been drinking before you drove?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you think that you put him in danger by driving that day?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Objection.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And Mr. Cecchino, you said that you are not going to take your license back; is that right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I'm not taking them back.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And is that your choice or PennDOT?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Huh?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is it your choice to not have a license any more, or did PennDOT say they won't give it back?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I'm not taking them back.  In fact, I went down to the driver center -- the driver center made up a photo ID, which I don't understand something about that.  It says right on the card, it says not legal identification, but it's a police station more or less, but yet they have I don't know how many people working there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: They won't let you fly on a plane with it.  You have to have a passport now, even if you just want to go to Philadelphia.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Of course most of the ones working were handicapped.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I get that.  So let me ask you a couple more questions, but we're almost done.  Okay?  I know you said that you had been stopped at a stop sign on Weller Drive; right?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I stopped and waited.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Before you turned left on to Perry Highway?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So how fast do you think your car was going at the time of the impact?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I guess about -- I was just pulling out.  I guess I was going about two or three miles.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And there is just a stop sign for you.  Is there any type of sign or light for traffic that's on Perry Highway?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: No.  It just had the stop sign coming out of the one street where I was coming out of.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I don't have anymore questions for you, Mr. Cecchino.  Your attorney may want to ask you some.
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: I don't have any questions right now.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: Did you want to waive or read?
speaker: MS. CORBETT

text: We'll read.
speaker: MR. CROUMER

text: (Signature not waived.)

(Whereupon, the above-entitled matter was concluded at 1:16 p.m. this date.) COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA    )    E R R A T A MICHAEL MILLER EUGENE CECCHINO, JR. I, EUGENE CECCHINO, JR., have read the foregoing 2019, and wish to make the following, if any, amendments, In all other respects, the transcript is true and

________________________________ COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA) I, Monica R. Chandler, a notary public in and that the witness, EUGENE CECCHINO, JR., was by me first nothing but the truth; that the foregoing deposition was said deposition was recorded stenographically by me and constitutes a true record of the testimony given by said and signing of said deposition were not waived by counsel after 30 days the transcript has not been signed by said failed to respond and the deposition may then be used as employee of either counsel and that I am in no way and affixed my seal of office this 26th day of August S/Monica R. Chandler MONICA R. CHANDLER
